eeff_example.cpp

This is an example of how to calculate and output the effective helical ripple for transport.
  V.V.Nemov,S.V.Kasilov,W.Kernbichler,M.F.Heyn, Physics of Plasmas, vol.6,4622(1999).
  V.V.Nemov,S.V.Kasilov,W.Kernbichler,M.F.Heyn, 28th EPS, Madeira.

#include "../include/CStconfig.h"
#include <iostream>


//*********************************************************************
// calculate and print effective helical ripple
//
int main(int argc, char* argv[])
{ 
  MConf::CStconfig mc("w7x-sc1.bc");
  if(!mc.isOK()) return 1;
  
  mc.truncate(1e-6); // truncate Bmn spectrum at level Bmn/B00 = 1e-6

  std::cout <<"#r/a         e_eff,%"<<std::endl;  
  std::cout.precision(3);
  std::cout.setf(std::ios::scientific);

  const int maxP = 30;

  for(int i=0; i<maxP; i++) {
    double x = 0.05+(0.975-0.05)*i/(maxP-1);    // x=sqrt(s)
    double s = x*x;
    std::cout<<x<<" "<<mc.epsEffVmec(s)*100<<std::endl;
  }
  
  return 0;
}
